moves.1. e4: ...this is a quick game....where black has to be a little more careful of nasty tactics...
...black is developing well..White is looking to set up a clamp position on the dark squares and push kingside...
moves.7. Na3: ..should have played this move earlier...but i didn't..
moves.7... cxd4 8. Bd3 Bxa3: ..black gets in a good move to disrupt the queenside pawns...and will gain material as a result...
moves.9. bxa3 dxc3 10. Qc2: ..i've focussed on development rather than worrying about the pawn, blacks white square bishop is stuck, Ra8 is doing nothing and his only viable option is 0-0....
moves.10... d4 11. O-O O-O: ...Bxf5 will only help black in the position as he has 2 strong passed pawns if he gets active....
moves.12. g4: ..logical solution..move the knight and attack h7 gaining a pawn back..
moves.12... Nh4 13. Bxh7+ Kh8: ..Nxh4 is only good for black so the very nasty move is played instead...
moves.14. Ng5: ..the knight is in a great position and cannot be moved. f6 is countered by exf6 and Qf2 is coming home to take the gold...
moves.14... Ng6 15. Bxg6: ..with the knight in such a great position its just how the queen gets to the h file to deliver mate...
moves.15... f5:
..interesting and reasonable move. exf ep or gxf5 allow Ne7 and possible defenses but ultimately Qxg5 will have to be played to save the game..
Rf3-h3 is also nasty..
moves.16. Qf2: ..the easy way..Qxg5 is forced but after fxg5, Qh4+ brings more pain...
